Package entities.trees

Class Tree_ThetaJoin_Query

  • java.lang.Object
    • entities.trees.Tree_ThetaJoin_Query
  • public class Tree_ThetaJoin_Query
extends Object
    A theta-join query where the relational atoms are organized in a tree. The join conditions between the relations are specified as a list of lists of @link{entities.Join_Predicate}. Each element of the list refers to one of the joins between a relation and its parent in the tree. (The first element that corresponds to the root relation is null). The predicates are given in a DNF form as a list of lists. The elements of the outer list are combined with disjunction. The elements of the inner lists are combined with conjunction. WARNING: we assume that for every @link{entities.Join_Predicate}, the first attribute refers to the parent and the second to the child.
    Author:
    Nikolaos Tziavelis

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      List<List<List<Join_Predicate>>> join_conditions
      join_conditions[i] refers to the join between relation i and its parent.
      int length
      The number of relations.
      List<Integer> parents
      Encodes the tree structure by storing the parent of each relation (which is unique).
      List<Relation> relations
      The relations that are part of the query (the nodes of the tree).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Tree_ThetaJoin_Query()
      A tree query initialized with no relations.
      Tree_ThetaJoin_Query​(int no)
      Returns a small example for debugging purposes.

    • Method Detail

      • add_to_tree_wDNF

        public void add_to_tree_wDNF​(Relation r,
                             int idx,
                             int parent_idx,
                             List<List<Join_Predicate>> cond)
        Adds a relation to the tree with a DNF as the join condition.
        Parameters:
        r - The relation to be added.
        idx - The index of the relation to be added (a child index cannot be smaller than its parent's).
        parent_idx - The index of the parent relation (the root should have index 0 and its parent -1).
        ps - A list of conjuncts for the join condition between the new relation and its parent.

      • add_to_tree_wConjunction

        public void add_to_tree_wConjunction​(Relation r,
                                     int idx,
                                     int parent_idx,
                                     List<Join_Predicate> ps)
        Adds a relation to the tree with a conjunction as the join condition.
        Parameters:
        r - The relation to be added.
        idx - The index of the relation to be added (a child index cannot be smaller than its parent's).
        parent_idx - The index of the parent relation (the root should have index 0 and its parent -1).
        ps - A list of conjucts for the join condition between the new relation and its parent.

      • set_join_conditions_as_conjunction

        public void set_join_conditions_as_conjunction​(List<Join_Predicate> preds)
        Sets the same join condition between all pairs of relations in the tree. The condition has to be a conjunction of atomic predicates. Disjunctions are not supported by this method.
        Parameters:
        preds - A conjunction of predicates as a list.

      • set_join_conditions_as_dnf

        public void set_join_conditions_as_dnf​(List<List<Join_Predicate>> cond)
        Sets the same join condition between all pairs of relations in the tree. The condition has to be a disjunction of conjunctions (DNF).
        Parameters:
        cond - A DNF formula as a list of lists of atomic predicates.

      • relation_is_leaf

        public boolean relation_is_leaf​(int relation_idx)
        Returns whether a particular relation is a leaf in the join-tree of the query. The current implementation of this method takes linear time in the size of the query.
        Parameters:
        relation_idx - The index of the relation to be checked.

      • num_children

        public int num_children​(int relation_idx)
        Returns the number of children that a relation has in the join-tree of the query. The current implementation of this method takes linear time in the size of the query.
        Parameters:
        relation_idx - The index of the relation.

      • get_children_lists

        public List<List<Integer>> get_children_lists()
        Returns a list that contains in position i the children of node i. Takes linear time in the size of the query.
        Parameters:
        relation_idx - The index of the relation.

      • get_children

        public List<Integer> get_children​(int relation_idx)
        Returns the of children that a relation has in the join-tree of the query. The current implementation of this method takes linear time in the size of the query.
        Parameters:
        relation_idx - The index of the relation.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        String The predicate in string format
